content.question: In the sixth sentence of the third paragraph (“The near-global diffusion...opposite effect”), the author mentions the diffusion of English primarily to

choices.label: challenge an assumption that other arguments depend on
emphasize how one phenomenon can have multiple effects
justify his use of one language rather than another
acknowledge the validity of one element of an argument he generally opposes

content.answer: acknowledge the validity of one element of an argument he generally opposes
